messages.content: Pull out the notes in this perfume and make a table to show a set of different types of perfume with a similar profile and the notes they need as a top/base/mid and be sure to include petrichor geosmine copper woody other types of essences

Sure, I can certainly help you compile a table to give an idea about a set of different types of perfumes that might have similar profiles and include notes of petrichor, geosmine, copper, and woody essences among others. Let's first define what these terms refer to:

- Petrichor: The scent of rain on dry earth or dust. It's a complex scent that's often described as earthy, fresh, and comforting.

- Geosmine: An organic compound that has a distinct earthy or musty odor, which is most notably present in the air when it rains.

- Copper: A unique metallic note that adds a 'cool' or 'sharp' tone to fragrances.

- Woody essences: These are typically warm, earthy, and rich. They can include essences like cedar, sandalwood, and vetiver.

Here's a table of different types of perfume profiles, which includes these notes:

| Perfume Name | Top Notes | Middle Notes | Base Notes |
|--------------|-----------|--------------|------------|
| Rainforest Dew | Green leaves, Lime | Petrichor, Jasmine | Geosmine, Moss |
| Earth's Embrace | Bergamot, Petrichor | Geosmine, Rose | Patchouli, Amber |
| Rustic Metal | Copper, Grapefruit | Rose, Jasmine | Woody essences, Musk |
| Mystic Woods | Lemon, Mint | Copper, Iris | Woody essences, Vanilla |
| Morning Rain | Petrichor, Green Apple | Freesia, Geosmine | Sandalwood, Ambergris |
| Velvet Earth | Black Currant, Copper | Geosmine, Jasmine | Patchouli, Woody essences |
| Twilight Petrichor | Petrichor, Lime | Violet, Geosmine | Woody essences, Moss |

Remember that scent perception can be highly personal and subjective, so different individuals might perceive these fragrances in different ways. Also, perfumes can evolve on the skin over time, so the initial smell might be quite different from the smell after a few hours of wear.
remove copper and add something that is purchaseable that has a similar profile

Of course, I can certainly make that adjustment. Here's a modified table with some purchasable fragrances that have a similar profile without copper, but include petrichor, geosmine, and woody notes:

| Perfume Name | Top Notes | Middle Notes | Base Notes |
|--------------|-----------|--------------|------------|
| Jo Malone - Wood Sage & Sea Salt | Ambrette Seeds, Sea Salt | Sage | SeaWeed, Grapefruit |
| Demeter Fragrance - Thunderstorm | Ozone, White Flowers | Petrichor | Earthy notes, Geosmine |
| Tom Ford - Oud Wood | Cardamom, Rosewood | Oud Wood, Sandalwood | Vetiver, Tonka Bean |
| Le Labo - Santal 33 | Cardamom, Iris | Violet, Cedarwood | Sandalwood, Amber |
| Maison Margiela - Replica: Lazy Sunday Morning | Pear, Ambrette | Iris, Rose | Musk, Woody notes |
| CB I Hate Perfume - At The Beach 1966 | Seawater, Sand | Seashell accord, White Flowers | Woody notes, Sea Grass |
| Byredo - Bal d'Afrique | African Marigold, Bergamot | Violet, Jasmine | Vetiver, Cedarwood |

These are commercially available perfumes that somewhat resemble the desired profile. They may not have all the notes but they could give a similar feeling. Please note that perfumes can be complex and might have more notes than the ones listed above. Furthermore, perfume scents can vary widely based on individual skin chemistry and perception.
how can we add a sea salt scent, does that make sense it's a mineral - sea water and sand? maybe keep it all essential oils

Certainly, you can add a sea salt scent to a perfume composition. Sea salt as a note in perfume does not refer to the actual ingredient, but rather the effect of the combination of various materials that give off a scent reminiscent of the ocean air. It is a mineral, but in perfumery, it's used more to represent an accord or a blend of different notes that together evoke the scent of sea salt.

In terms of essential oils, there are quite a few that can give a salty, oceanic, or mineral-like feel to a perfume. Seaweed absolute, for instance, can give a sea-like feel. Other essential oils like vetiver, oakmoss, and certain types of citrus can also contribute to a salt-air impression.

Here's a revised table, using essential oils and other natural extracts:

| Perfume Name | Top Notes | Middle Notes | Base Notes |
|--------------|-----------|--------------|------------|
| Ocean Whisper | Bergamot, Lemon | Seaweed Absolute, Jasmine | Vetiver, Sandalwood |
| Earthy Rain | Petitgrain, Clary Sage | Vetiver, Rose | Patchouli, Oakmoss |
| Forest Dew | Lemon, Mint | Pine, Fir Needle | Cedarwood, Vetiver |
| Sundrenched Meadow | Grapefruit, Sweet Orange | Lavender, Geranium | Vetiver, Sandalwood |
| Midnight Woods | Black Pepper, Bergamot | Pine, Juniper Berry | Cedarwood, Frankincense |
| Enchanted Garden | Sweet Orange, Lemon | Jasmine, Ylang Ylang | Patchouli, Sandalwood |

Keep in mind that while it's possible to create a perfume using only essential oils and natural extracts, these components still need to be blended and diluted properly to ensure they're safe for use on the skin. It's also important to remember that everyone's sense of smell is unique, so these perfumes might smell slightly different to different people.
add more geosmine to the different perfumes above and update the notes/names

Certainly, I can adjust the table to include more geosmine in the perfume profiles. Please note, however, that geosmine has a strong earthy scent that can overpower other notes if not balanced correctly. Here's a revised table:

| Perfume Name | Top Notes | Middle Notes | Base Notes |
|--------------|-----------|--------------|------------|
| Ocean Echoes | Bergamot, Lemon | Seaweed Absolute, Geosmine | Vetiver, Sandalwood |
| Geosmin Rain | Petitgrain, Clary Sage | Vetiver, Geosmine | Patchouli, Oakmoss |
| Forest Undergrowth | Lemon, Mint | Pine, Geosmine | Cedarwood, Vetiver |
| Meadow Geosmin | Grapefruit, Sweet Orange | Lavender, Geosmine | Vetiver, Sandalwood |
| Midnight Soil | Black Pepper, Bergamot | Pine, Geosmine | Cedarwood, Frankincense |
| Enchanted Earth | Sweet Orange, Lemon | Jasmine, Geosmine | Patchouli, Sandalwood |

These are conceptual blends that might not be available for direct purchase in the market. However, you could have them custom-made by a professional perfumer or you could try making them yourself if you have access to the necessary essential oils and other materials. Remember that creating perfumes involves a lot of experimentation and patience.
can we also add more oud and woody notes

Absolutely, we can incorporate more oud and woody notes into the table. Here's an updated table:

| Perfume Name | Top Notes | Middle Notes | Base Notes |
|--------------|-----------|--------------|------------|
| Oud Sea Echoes | Bergamot, Lemon | Seaweed Absolute, Geosmine | Oud, Vetiver, Sandalwood |
| Rainy Oud Woods | Petitgrain, Clary Sage | Vetiver, Geosmine | Oud, Patchouli, Oakmoss |
| Forest Undergrowth Oud | Lemon, Mint | Pine, Geosmine | Oud, Cedarwood, Vetiver |
| Oud Meadow | Grapefruit, Sweet Orange | Lavender, Geosmine | Oud, Vetiver, Sandalwood |
| Midnight Oud Soil | Black Pepper, Bergamot | Pine, Geosmine | Oud, Cedarwood, Frankincense |
| Enchanted Oud Earth | Sweet Orange, Lemon | Jasmine, Geosmine | Oud, Patchouli, Sandalwood |

Oud, also known as agarwood, is one of the most expensive ingredients in perfumery. It has a complex, rich, and woody scent that adds depth and sophistication to perfumes. Keep in mind that when creating perfumes, the balance of notes is important, and the concentration of each ingredient can significantly impact the final scent. Also, everyone's sense of smell is unique, so these perfumes might smell slightly different to different people.
what about oud and other woody nots

Certainly, we can incorporate more oud and other various woody notes into the fragrance profiles. Here's the updated table:

| Perfume Name | Top Notes | Middle Notes | Base Notes |
|--------------|-----------|--------------|------------|
| Oud & Cedar Sea Echoes | Bergamot, Lemon | Seaweed Absolute, Geosmine | Oud, Cedarwood, Sandalwood |
| Oud Rain & Oak | Petitgrain, Clary Sage | Vetiver, Geosmine | Oud, Patchouli, Oakmoss |
| Oud Forest & Pine | Lemon, Mint | Pine, Geosmine | Oud, Pine, Vetiver |
| Oud Meadow & Sandalwood | Grapefruit, Sweet Orange | Lavender, Geosmine | Oud, Sandalwood, Cedarwood |
| Oud Midnight & Cypress | Black Pepper, Bergamot | Pine, Geosmine | Oud, Cypress, Frankincense |
| Enchanted Oud Earth & Rosewood | Sweet Orange, Lemon | Jasmine, Geosmine | Oud, Rosewood, Sandalwood |

These fragrances would be rich, complex, and grounded with a noticeable presence of oud and various woody notes, layered with the earthiness of geosmine. It's important to note that individual perception of these scents can vary, and the actual balance of these notes can make a significant difference in the final result. As always, careful blending and testing are essential in perfume creation.

Pull out the notes in this perfume and make a table to show a set of different types of perfume with a similar profile and the notes they need as a top/base/mid and be sure to include petrichor geosmine copper woody other types of essences:
Boisé 

Notes de tête :
Bergamote, Orange

Notes de coeur :
Huile d'amyris, Coriandre de Russie, Huile de bois d'agar

Notes de fond :
Bois de cèdre, Bois de santal, Huile de Patchouli, Accord de cuir, Musc

Absolutely, here is a breakdown of the notes in Boisé:

- Top notes: Bergamot, Orange
- Middle notes: Amyris oil, Russian Coriander, Agarwood oil
- Base notes: Cedarwood, Sandalwood, Patchouli oil, Leather Accord, Musk

Now, let's create a table for a set of different perfumes with a similar woody, aromatic profile:

| Perfume Name | Top Notes | Middle Notes | Base Notes |
|--------------|-------------|----------------|-------------|
| Boisé         | Bergamot, Orange | Amyris oil, Russian Coriander, Agarwood oil | Cedarwood, Sandalwood, Patchouli oil, Leather Accord, Musk |
| Forest Rain   | Petrichor, Lemon | Juniper berries, Agarwood oil, Cedar | Oakmoss, Patchouli oil, Vetiver |
| Earthy Whisper | Bergamot, Green leaves | Geosmin, Vetiver, Iris | Cedarwood, Musk, Soil tincture |
| Copper Wood   | Copper, Orange | Pine, Russian Coriander, Birch tar | Sandalwood, Leather Accord, Patchouli oil |
| Velvet Musk   | Bergamot, Pepper | Amyris oil, Agarwood oil, Jasmine | Musk, Leather Accord, Sandalwood |
| Oceanic Agarwood | Ocean mist, Bergamot | Seaweed, Agarwood oil, Russian Coriander | Driftwood, Musk, Ambergris |
| Metallic Leather | Bergamot, Copper | Leather Accord, Agarwood oil, Rose | Sandalwood, Patchouli oil, Vetiver |

The top notes are the first scent released by a fragrance. The middle notes, or heart notes, emerge after the top notes dissipate. The base notes are the final fragrance notes that appear once the top notes are completely evaporated. 

Keep in mind that the essence and scent of a perfume are quite subjective and can vary significantly based on personal perception, body chemistry, and the environment in which the perfume is worn.

Pull out the notes in this perfume and make a table to show a set of different types of perfume with a similar profile and the notes they need as a top/base/mid and be sure to include petrichor/ geosmine notes:
Boisé 

Notes de tête :
Bergamote, Orange

Notes de coeur :
Huile d'amyris, Coriandre de Russie, Huile de bois d'agar

Notes de fond :
Bois de cèdre, Bois de santal, Huile de Patchouli, Accord de cuir, Musc

Sure, here's a comparative table of different types of perfumes with similar profiles to Boisé. Note that each perfume has a distinct set of top, mid (heart), and base notes. I included perfumes with the notes of petrichor or geosmine which offer the smell of rain or wet earth:

| Perfume        | Top Notes                     | Mid (Heart) Notes                                          | Base Notes                                          | Note Profile               |
|----------------|-------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------|----------------------------|
| Boisé          | Bergamot, Orange              | Amyris Oil, Russian Coriander, Agarwood Oil                | Cedarwood, Sandalwood, Patchouli Oil, Leather, Musk| Woody, Citrus, Leather     |
| Rainfall       | Lemon, Petrichor              | Geosmine, Agarwood Oil, Russian Coriander                  | Cedarwood, Sandalwood, Musk                        | Earthy, Woody, Fresh       |
| Terra          | Bergamot, Petrichor           | Amyris Oil, Russian Coriander                              | Patchouli Oil, Cedarwood, Leather                  | Earthy, Woody, Citrus      |
| Forest Echo    | Orange, Bergamot, Geosmine    | Russian Coriander, Agarwood Oil, Amyris Oil                | Cedarwood, Sandalwood, Leather, Musk               | Earthy, Woody, Citrus      |
| Agar Aura      | Petrichor, Orange             | Amyris Oil, Agarwood Oil, Russian Coriander                | Patchouli Oil, Cedarwood, Sandalwood, Musk         | Earthy, Woody, Citrus      |
| Rustic Leather | Bergamot, Geosmine            | Russian Coriander, Amyris Oil                              | Patchouli Oil, Leather, Cedarwood, Musk            | Earthy, Woody, Leather     |
| Verdant Veil   | Lemon, Orange, Petrichor      | Amyris Oil, Agarwood Oil                                   | Sandalwood, Patchouli Oil, Leather, Cedarwood, Musk| Citrus, Earthy, Woody      |

Please remember that creating a perfume is an art, and the balance and proportion of these notes are just as important as the notes themselves. The addition of petrichor and geosmine adds an earthy, damp freshness to these profiles, reminiscent of a forest or just after rainfall.
